abstract.text: A 3×3 matrix for representing 3D rotation and scale.

inlineContent.text: used to represent 3D rotation, scale, and shear. It is frequently used within a
is composed by 3 axis vectors, each representing a column of the matrix:

) influences the basis’s scale, while the direction of all axes influence the rotation. Usually, these axes are perpendicular to one another. However, when you rotate any axis individually, the basis becomes sheared. Applying a sheared basis to a 3D model will make the model appear distorted.

order, which is the same as OpenGL. However, they are stored internally in row-major order, which is the same as DirectX.
